## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

                         header = TRUE, 
                         sep = ",",  
                         encoding = "latin1")%>%

```{r}
World_Countries <- st_read("D:/UCL/CASA0005/03GIS/wk4/homework/World_Countries_(Generalized)/World_Countries__Generalized_.shp")%>%
na.omit()%>%
clean_names()
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
class(World_Countries)
```
```{r}
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}
gender_inequality_cols<-gender_inequality %>%
  dplyr::select(c(iso3,country,gii_2010,gii_2019))

gender_inequality_cols
```

```{r}
gender_inequality_cols2 <- gender_inequality_cols %>%
  mutate(diff=gii_2019-gii_2010)
  
gender_inequality_cols2
```

```{r}
World_Countries2 <- World_Countries %>% 
  left_join(., 
            gender_inequality_cols2, 
            by = c("country" = "country"))

World_Countries2
```
